Case reference: 2011000699.CaseDesc: On 23 May 1985, William Drake walked out of the Pinecrest Home for senior citizens, where he lived.  He was last seen at 9:30 am walking eastbound on highway 17 in Kenora, near the Sunset Husky gas station.  His family and friends have not heard from him since. Mr. Drake is reported to be hard of hearing and diabetic.

Pants: Light Blue, small checks and suspenders

Case reference: 2022064778.CaseDesc: Justin McMillan was last seen at his home in Keswick Ridge, New Brunswick, on December 19th, 2022. Law enforcement has explored numerous avenues to locate Justin with no success.

Case reference: 2014001102.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1973, the remains of a young adult man were recovered from the Burrard Inlet in Vancouver, British Columbia. He carried a Canada flag pocket knife and is believed to have been in the water for several months prior to the discovery.

Case reference: 2010000699.CaseDesc: William Ostertag last spoke to his brother on December 16, 1990.  He was reported missing when he failed to show up for his work Christmas party in North Bay.

Hair: Black, Short, Comb over, moustache, sideburns
Coat: May have been wearing a blue or grey coat

Case reference: 2014002549.CaseDesc: Wladyslaw Klisko was last seen on September 11, 1983, in Montreal. He left his house in the morning to go to church. He took the bus but was not seen at the church.

Case reference: 2021008285.CaseDesc: Trenton Phillips was last seen by a family member at their residence in Red Deer, Alberta in the summer of 2017.  Trenton told the family member he was going to Kenya in Africa with Lifewater to build wells.

Case reference: 2014003424.CaseDesc: On December 5, 1992, Marie Trahan was last seen in Petit-Shippagan, New Brunswick.  Marie's abandoned vehicle was later located at the wharf.

Case reference: 2008016999.CaseDesc: Meryl Newcombe and George Weeden were last seen and reported missing to the White River OPP on October 29, 1959. The two men had been at a lodge operated by Mr. Newcombe at Mile 107 of the CPR line, west of Chapleau, Ontario. Mr. Weeden and Mr. Newcombe had planned a hunting trip and both were last seen between mile marker 106 and 107 of the CPR line southeast of White River and west of Chapleau. A large-scale search was conducted at the time, and again in the following spring (1960).  The search failed to locate the two men, and to date, they have not been located. Mr. Weeden exact date of birth is not known, but his year of birth is understood to be 1896 or 1897.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Leg, injured in a train wreck in 1941

Case reference: 2014045101.CaseDesc: The partial remains of an older adult female were found near Chasm, British Colombia in 2010. She had no teeth in her lower jaw and had likely gone missing many years earlier.

Case reference: 2006010399.CaseDesc: William Halverson was last seen getting into a canoe at Bald Indian Bay in Lake of the Woods. He failed to arrive at his destination of Pine Portage Bay.

Case reference: 1999003370.CaseDesc: Nancy Liou was last seen at home on January 27, 1999. On January 28, her father contacted Nancy's school to see if she was there, and was advised they had no way of knowing if she was in attendance as it was exam time. Her father contacted police that evening when she failed to return home from school.  She had advised a family member she was leaving but never said where she was headed.

Case reference: 2010004199.CaseDesc: Kalon Purvis had been living and working in the Minden area since early May 2008.  He had been involved in a car accident on June 19, 2008 resulting in him needing to use a rental car.  The small red rental car was returned sometime in July.  Mr. Purvis was last seen in July 2008 when he was dropped off in the area of the Home Hardware store in Minden to meet someone he was going to do some work for, for two weeks.  Mr. Purvis would have had a large male dog (Rottweiler) named Magnum with him around the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Black, Wavy, Medium length and parted in the middle
Tattoo: Abdomen, Incomplete graphic of horse heads

Case reference: 2014004308.CaseDesc: Joseph Laboucan was last seen in Peace River, Alberta, on or around August 10, 1998. He lived on the streets in Peace River and Little Buffalo, Alberta. He made occasional trips around the area as far as Edmonton.

Case reference: 2014002695.CaseDesc: Harold Wagner was last seen on June 4, 1988, at Fur Lake in the Mont Nebo district, SK. Mr. Wagner was swimming from his boat when he disappeared.

Shorts: Cloth, White, Red, White swim trunks with red, blue and red stripes

Case reference: 2011000299.CaseDesc: On September 2, 2010, the skeletal remains of a Caucasian male were found in the forest near Chemin Lac Clair in West Nipissing, Ontario. He is believed to have been there from two weeks to six months.

Hair: Brown, Short, Shorter than collar length
Teeth: Some dental work and some untreated dental disease
Other: Signs of arthritis in his feet. Bandages on them suggesting that he may have experienced pain

Case reference: 2014006241.CaseDesc: On September 7, 2013, at approximately 10:00 a.m., Ranjit Singh was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Ranjit was visiting Toronto from India was scheduled to return on a 5:00 p.m. flight, but he never boarded the plane.

Case reference: 2020007935.CaseDesc: On December 2, 1981, at approximately 4:30 pm, Everett Comer was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Everett was scheduled to work, but did not show for his shift.

Suit: Blue, Uniform, "Extendicare" uniform with the word "Lyle" on the front pocket

Case reference: 2006013599.CaseDesc: Donald Taylor has been missing from South Porcupine, Ontario since August 24, 1989 at 7:00 in the morning and has not been seen since.

Boots: Leather, Tan, "Kodiak" Steel toe work boots

Case reference: 2014005295.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2007, at approximately 10:30 p.m., Javed Hoosain was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Javed had a dispute with his mother prior to leaving his residence.

Case reference: 2014000015.CaseDesc: On March 28, 2012 Allan Kinkaid was reported missing to the Calgary Police Service. Mr. Kinkaid had moved to Las Vegas, Nevada in 2006. He last had contact with his family in Calgary on December 25, 2009.

Hair: Brown, Straight, Other, Blonde patch, medium length

Case reference: 2014002370.CaseDesc: On June 16, 1997, at approximately 4:30 pm Kelvin Zdarski and two friends left Dauphin, Manitoba and headed for a cabin near Waterhen, Manitoba. Over the course of the evening there was an argument between the men. Kelvin left the cabin and never returned. The men looked for him on their way back to Dauphin and did not see him. A man matching Kelvin's description was seen walking on the road at 7:30 am on the 17th of June. An extensive search by land, air and water proved negative. Kelvin did not take his wallet, money or any identification to the cabin and had no means of transportation. Mr. Zdarski has not been seen or heard from again.

Scar: Left Calf, 1 inch long, back of calf

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered

Case reference: 2014001428.CaseDesc: On May 19, 1998, at approximately 7:00 p.m., Rémi Engrand left a residence for men in Valleyfield, Quebec, for a walk with two other residents of the center where he had been staying for a few days. They went to the Delpha-Sauvé Park, where Rémi wanted to go swimming in the river, near the waterfall. The three separated, leaving Rémi alone and when they returned, they found Rémi’s clothes on the shoreline. The current in this section of the river is very fast and the presence of the falls makes swimming very risky. Rémi has not been seen since this time.

Case reference: 2014005569.CaseDesc: Steven O’Brien was last seen on March 20, 1993. He was a first-year student at Holland College’s Culinary Institute in Charlottetown when he went missing after a night out with friends. Steven was last seen walking south on Queen Street in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, around 1:30 am.

Case reference: 2014002762.CaseDesc: On March 3rd, 1982, Laurence Peterson and Randolph Johanson were reported missing by Mr. Johanson’s girlfriend. Mr. Johanson and Mr. Peterson were last seen on February 28th, 1982, leaving the Shelter Island Marina, on their boats. Mr. Johanson was reportedly using his 26 ft. long salvage tug boat to haul Mr. Peterson’s 43 ft. wooden halibut fishing vessel to Lund, BC. The men were reported missing when they did not arrive at their destination. Extensive searches were unsuccessful. It has been speculated that the two men disappeared to start a new life.

Teeth: Other, Wide space in between the front teeth
Scar: Chest, 1 inch scar on left breast

Case reference: 2014003927.CaseDesc: On April 8, 1983, Blake Moorehouse was last seen between 2:00 pm and 6:00 pm in Richmond, British Columbia. There is reason to believe that Mr. Moorehouse and his companion Harold Brentzen left for the day to go freshwater fishing. The boat that Mr. Moorehouse and Mr.Brentzen were on board was recovered approximately 1.2 km north of the Roberts Creek Terminal. Mr. Brentzen's body was recovered near the boat, but Mr. Moorehouse was not located.

Case reference: 2012020006.CaseDesc: Lucas James Degerness was last seen on June 7, 2007 in Prince George, British-Columbia. He spent that night with a friend.

Mark: Torso (Back), Brown in color, left side
Head, Dime size bald spot - front

Case reference: 2014047277.CaseDesc: On December 16, 2014, at approximately 10:30 a.m., Abdool Kisson was last seen leaving his ex-girlfriend’s house in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003903.CaseDesc: Anthony Kootenay walked away from the Algar Tower fire camp 73 kilometres south of Fort McMurray, Alberta on July 13, 1985 at approximately 3:00 am. In the previous days he was described by colleagues as suffering from mental health issues related to alcohol abuse. It is believed he may have attempted to hitch-hike from the area as a passing motorist spotted someone matching his description. An extensive search by land and helicopter was conducted, however Anthony was not located. Two unconfirmed sightings occurred at the Grand Hotel in Edmonton, AB on December 23, 1985 and January 16, 1986. There have been no sightings since that time.

Shoes: Blue, Running shoes with no laces
Tattoo: Left Hand, Tony on the 4 fingers
Left Arm, A flower with 4 petals

Case reference: 2018016431.CaseDesc: On March 22, 2018, Crystal Hackett was seen for the last time in Lloydminster, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Crystal may have been suffering from mental health issues.

Scar: Jaw, Thin white scar on the right side of jaw

Case reference: 2014001966.CaseDesc: On September 10, 1976, Edwin Lewitsky was seen for the last time in Wellandport, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Edward was driving a 1970 two-toned green Ford Galaxy.

Case reference: 1999000140.CaseDesc: On April 3, 1993, Mary Nancy Goodfellow left home in the company of her grandson Kevin James Charles. Nothing has been heard from them since.

Scar: Forehead, scar on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2020051730.CaseDesc: On Dec 10, 2020, Gurpreet Singh Parmar was last seen on a video surveillance camera walking away from his family residence in Abbotsford, British Columbia.  Gurpreet has not been seen or heard from since.

Backpack: Other, Lunch bag or Lunch pail with shoulder strap
Hat: Other, Possibly wearing a brimmed hat
Pants: Other, Possibly wearing dark pants or sweatpants
Sweater: Other, Dark coloured sweater, hoodie or jacket, possibly red

Case reference: 2021042160.CaseDesc: On September 16, 2021, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Darren Werner was last seen at his residence in the town Niagara-on-the-Lake in Ontario. It is possible that Darren had gotten into an unknown vehicle.

Case reference: 2014004058.CaseDesc: On January 11, 2001, Yvan Martellino was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Yvan was baptized in the name of Joseph Pierre Raymond Lussier. He studied communication and accounting. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003793.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1980, Keith Dufour was seen for the last time at his residence in the town of Amherstburg, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Keith was suffering from mental health issues.

Scar: Forehead, Right temple on the forehead

Case reference: 2010001999.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Dekleyn was last seen on December 3, 1992, at 1:35 p.m. on a Hamilton RBC bank surveillance camera, making a withdrawal from an ATM machine. Family have not seen or heard from him since and described Mr. Dekleyn as being depressed.

Jacket: Brown, with the Dempsters logo on the left chest
Scar: Torso (Front), Front-to-Back scar on abdomen from surgery to remove kidney.

Case reference: 2019002992.CaseDesc: On August 25, 2018, Anupama Nadagouda was seen for the last time with her daughter, Anvita Mulemane, in India.

Case reference: 2014027689.CaseDesc: Sindy Ruperthouse's family has had no news of her since April 2014 and on September 2, 2014, they reported her missing to the Sûreté du Québec of Amos. Mrs. Ruperthouse was last seen in Val d'Or on April 22, 2014 during a consultation at the Local Community Service Centre (CLSC).

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 2014005607.CaseDesc: Eleanor Eatha Parkinson-Jenkins was last seen on Monday March 1, 1982. At that time, she was living in Saint-Bruno-de Montarville. She was reported missing by her family. Ms. Parkinson-Jenkins had been ill for the past six months. She would normally leave a note when she left, but not that morning. She usually spent her days in bed or never went out alone. She would have left after the departure of her husband and did not take her purse with her. She left on foot and never came back. She is a originally from Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2021035166.CaseDesc: On July 10, 2021, Nicole Frenchman was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Nicole was living with her friends, but had no fixed address. Nicole was normally very active on social media but has not accessed it since her disappearance.

Pierce: Upper Lip, Monroe piercing on left side
Tattoo: Left Side Of Neck, Leopard print
Right Side Of Neck, Red kiss lips
Right Hand, "Queen dubs dollar sign" on the middle finger
Right Forearm, Dreamcatcher; feathers; "Trust no one"

Case reference: 2014004248.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1979, at approximately 5:00 a.m., Myrna Montgrand was seen for the last time outside of a residence in La Loche, Saskatchewan. Earlier that morning, Myrna had been with a group of people at a party.

Case reference: 2014003895.CaseDesc: On April 30, 1993, RCMP were advised Diana Thomas had fallen through the ice and had not surfaced. Diana was a passenger on a ski-doo along with her mother and a 13 year old driver. The threesome had only gone about 10 meters from shore when the back of the ski-doo went into the water, quickly followed by the front. Diana fell into the water with her mother and never resurfaced. Attempts were made to recover Diana, however all efforts met with negative results.

Case reference: 2014005302.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2005, in Toronto, Canada, Zaina Trujillo-Talib was abducted by her father, Chaudhry Talib and her paternal grandmother, Shama Talib.  Chaudhry and Shama immediately took six-year-old Zaina to their family home located in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since this time, Zaina's mother has not been allowed to have any contact with her daughter.

Case reference: 2018063272.CaseDesc: On February 13, 2002, Wayne McMahon was seen for the last time by his building's superintendent in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005105.CaseDesc: On May 11, 2001, at approximately 8:00 p.m., Younes Taleb was seen for the last time at his mother’s business in Toronto, Ontario.

Mark: Cheek, Mole on the right cheek

Case reference: 2018063460.CaseDesc: On October 13, 1992, at approximately 8:30 am, Debra Kumar was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016026140.CaseDesc: Amber Wilson was last seen at 9:30pm on May 15, 2016, in Edmonton's downtown area. Amber has medical issues, and she is dependent on her medication. Amber lives a high risk lifestyle, and it is out of character for her not to be in contact with her family. Her family is extremely concerned for her welfare.

Case reference: 2014004386.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2003, Adolph Sewap was last seen in Sturgeon Landing near Creighton, Saskatchewan. Adolph had some medical issues and was known to travel to other communities.

Other: Walks bent forward with hands behind his back

Case reference: 2016046700.CaseDesc: Mr. LADD was last seen on August 18, 2016, by his daughter at his residence where he prepared them dinner.  Mr. LADD stated he needed to run out for a while and did not return.

Case reference: 2012020059.CaseDesc: On August 13, 1967, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Sylvia Klayh was seen for the last time as she left her family’s cottage in Brereton Lake, Manitoba. Prior to her disappearance, Sylvia had a verbal disagreement with her father, and left the cottage without saying anything. There is a possibility of foul play, as she has never attempted to contact any of her family members.

Case reference: 2012020019.CaseDesc: Emerson Dobroskay, was last seen on October 28, 1988 at the Pit Pub located at the University of British Columbia. It is believed that Emerson may have fallen into a large pit dug for construction, but all searches have failed to locate him. Although foul play is not suspected, it cannot be ruled out.

Case reference: 2006028299.CaseDesc: Shawn McConkey was last seen leaving work on December 21, 2001. That same day, his vehicle was involved in a single vehicle collision on County Road #22 in Otonabee-South Monaghan Township. No one was located at the scene of the accident. A search of the area has failed to locate Mr. McConkey and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Shirt: Denim, Blue, Emblem over left pocket and name over right pocket
Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Picture of a skull and the word "Tom"
Right Hand, Trees and a cross
Right Upper Arm, Picture of Hitler

Case reference: 2014004932.CaseDesc: Mathieu Daneau's disappearance occurred on April 3, 2007 in the region of St-Hyacinthe, Quebec. Mr. Daneau was admitted for treatment at the L'Envolée center. He left the center and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2008011099.CaseDesc: Michael Hart left the Langton area to look for work in Western Canada as a skilled tradesman. He had maintained contact with his parents by telephone and through his banking. His parents are worried as they have had no contact with him since May 24, 1996.

Case reference: 2022014037.CaseDesc: On March 23, 2022, Roger Vidito was seen for the last time as he left his residence in the west-end of Ottawa, Ontario. Roger grew up on the east coast of Canada, and there may be a possibility that he travelled there.

Case reference: 2016061151.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2014, a male was recovered from a reservoir behind Energy Ottawa, building #511 at 4 Booth Street, Ottawa. His appendix and gallbladder are present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days to a few months.

Hair: Brown, Medium length; balding and face stuble
Teeth: Extensive amount of dental work including root canal, crowns, posts and composite resin fillings.
Other: Red, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 2 disposable lighters
cigarettes in a white opaque plastic container
a hand drawn map of the Richmond Rd/Churchill Ave area, drawn on a torn off cover of a notepad
folding knife with built in nail file and opener on a ring
3 keys (SM "ILCO" key, Curtis "SC1" & Oscar "WR3" house keys)

Case reference: 2014003208.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1996, Louie Stalthanee was last seen at approximately 4:00 p.m. on the East side of Fir Island on Black Lake in Saskatchewan. The boat he had been using was found beached on Fir Island. It is suspected that Mr. Stalthanee drowned; however he has never been located.

Case reference: 2020019009.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2020, Sameer Patel was seen for the last time by his friends when he accidentally fell into the Niagara River located in Ontario, while hiking.

Case reference: 2006007499.CaseDesc: David Goetz and Lucas Zenger were last seen on August 23, 1992, in the Owen Sound area. They went for a canoe ride.  They travelled down the shoreline along Kepple Township, towards Big Bay. The canoe was located approximately 1.5 miles off Cape Commodore.

Case reference: 2014004610.CaseDesc: On June 7, 1967, Absolom Halkett and his colleague, James Brady, were dropped off by plane at Foster Lake, SK, which is located 120 miles north west of La Ronge, SK. The two were prospecting in the area. They were last heard from on a radio call to a nearby mine on June 8th. Extensive land, air and water searches of the area failed to locate any trace of the two men. Their camp was located but had been unused.

Case reference: 2019073876.CaseDesc: On November 1, 2019, Anton Katona was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006349.CaseDesc: Jonathan Riley left his residence on April 26, 2013, indicating he was going to Toronto for a few days. His mode of transportation is unknown as he did not have access to a vehicle.  His family and friends have not heard from him since May 2013.  He is a self-employed computer technician.

Case reference: 2014006225.CaseDesc: On August 28, 2001, Erum KAMAL was seen for the last time near the High Level bridge in Edmonton, Alberta.  Erum was wearing a white t-shirt, blue pants and was described as a Southeast Asian from Pakistan.

Case reference: 2014004969.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1966, a friend asked Ronnie Harper to help him lift one of his nets out of the waters of Red Sucker Lake. The two men set off in a canoe. When they arrived at the site, the men pulled the line attached to the net, but it didn't move. Increasing their efforts, the men pulled harder and the line attached to the weight came loose. The sudden shift caused both men to lose their footing and the canoe to overturn. The men attempted to move closer to shore by pushing the canoe. After a time, Mr. Harper told his friend he was too tired to hold on any longer. His companion continued moving the canoe. The survivor then realized Mr. Harper was no longer hanging on. Efforts to locate Mr. Harper were unsuccessful and it is presumed he drowned.

Case reference: 2019058725.CaseDesc: In the spring of 2019, Glenn Field was seen for the last time by a pilot flying over his campsite located at Rolfe Lake, Northwest Territories. Glenn had flown out to Rolfe Lake in September of 2018 with the intentions of spending the winter living on the land and making his way back to Yellowknife, Northwest Territories, in the Spring of 2019. Glenn had three dogs with him and food to last the winter. The RCMP Search and Rescue conducted an areal search of Rolfe Lake in October of 2019, but found no signs of Glenn.

Case reference: 2014002315.CaseDesc: In 1983 Dennis Chubb moved to Winnipeg from God's Lake Narrows.  He was believed to be residing in a rooming house on Furby Street in the Downtown area of Winnipeg.  Dennis was last seen entering this rooming house after having been dropped off by a family member.  It is reported that Dennis moved from this rooming house and into another residence just prior to his disappearance. M. Chubb's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2012020129.CaseDesc: Nadine Lussier and Dominic Gauthier worked at a convenience store in Ste-Sophie. They were seen for the last time Wednesday, June 16th 2004. They left the convenience store around 3:00 p.m., and were then seen in a Prévost restaurant. Ms.Lussier's vehicle had not moved from the restaurant from the evening of Wednesday, June 16th 2004 and the time Dominic Gauthier's mother reported their disappearance on Friday June 18th 2004.

Case reference: 2016061381.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1970 a Caucasian male was found in the ravine just north of Beechwood Ave. The ravine was located 300 yards south of the Leaside Bridge and approximately 100 yards east of the Don River.

Other: Rifle - Winchester Model 94 30-30 calibre, with a black and white rifle case

Case reference: 2006022499.CaseDesc: Witold Sagin was last seen while fishing on Gordon Lake. He was fishing in a canoe, which was later found overturned. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014006426.CaseDesc: Sara Coates was last seen in the Stanley Park area in Calgary, Alberta. Ms. Coates was leading a nomadic lifestyle, living out of her van with her dog and 3 cats, travelling around Alberta and BC. Ms. Coates’ van was located October 22, 2013, in a secluded area of Morley, Alberta. It appeared to have been there for some time. Police investigations regarding Ms. Coates’ whereabouts are ongoing.

Scar: 2 small surgical scars on inner groin

Case reference: 2020007642.CaseDesc: On December 5, 1971, Ethel Crespo was last seen by her husband in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Ethel was two months pregnant.

Case reference: 2012020131.CaseDesc: Gilles Parisien, 53, was reported missing October 28, 2003. A witness claims to have seen him on October 9, 2003 in Malartic. At the time of his disappearance, he was at the Malartic Hospital Center.

Case reference: 2014001046.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1990, the body of this middle-aged man was found on Gore Avenue in Vancouver, British Columbia. He died of complications related to chronic alcohol dependence.

Hair: Blonde, Long dark blonde hair with greying beard
Jacket: Denim, Blue, Young Life Creator brand
Shoes: Grey, Nike Air brand, running shoes

Case reference: 2020038049.CaseDesc: On March 27, 2020, Joshua Reiner was reported missing to New York Police, in the United States. Joshua’s vehicle was located in Niagara Falls, New York. A male was later observed on surveillance cameras climbing over a railing and walking towards the brink of the falls. The male was later confirmed to be Joshua Reiner by family members. It is suspected that he jumped into the falls and did not resurface.

Case reference: 2014003894.CaseDesc: Jean Gravel and Jean-Guy Champagne were employees of the Rio Bar in downtown Trois-Rivières. On July 6, 1972, they arrived at work in the early evening; they were to work there until closing. They never returned home and have not been seen since. They were reported missing on July 10, 1972.

Jewelry: Gold, ring on the left ring finger
Silver, wedding ring on the left ring finger

Case reference: 2005001099.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2004, an unidentified woman was discovered in a red 2004 Toyota Corolla under the Highway 400 Bridge on Highway 401 in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts this female to be from the Americas, South Asia, or Mixed Americas.

Case reference: 2012020170.CaseDesc: An adult male was washed up along the south side of the beach at Stanley Park, near the 2000 block of Beach Avenue at English Bay in Vancouver.

Wallet: Black, Contained pliers and a jack knife
Mark: Forehead, Post mortem abrasion on the right side of the forehead

Case reference: 2006026499.CaseDesc: Simon McDonald was last seen on May 9, 2001, leaving his daughter's residence on the White Dog, First Nations Territory. He was known to enjoy walking along the river. Extensive searches of the area have failed to locate Mr. McDonald.

Hair: Black, Grey, Unkempt; Beard, Moustache, Sideburns
Shoes: Cloth, Red, Black, slippers with leather soles.

Case reference: 2017047885.CaseDesc: On July 31, 2017, Brayden Thibault was seen for the last time when he left Fredericton, New-Brunswick to meet someone in the City of Moncton, New-Brunswick. Brayden has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005330.CaseDesc: On September 13, 2009, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Rose Mackinnon was seen for the last time when she left the Earnestine Women’s shelter with her two children. Rose advised that she would be returning but has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004103.CaseDesc: Michelle Gurney was last seen in the downtown east side of Vancouver at the St. James Community Society building on December 11, 1998. She was reported missing ten days later. Ms. Gurney was engaged in a high risk lifestyle and had mental health issues.

Case reference: 2020016024.CaseDesc: In July of 2019, Anita Grace Wechsler was seen and heard from for the last time in Calgary, Alberta. During the time of Anita’s disappearance, she may have been despondent and involved in a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014001590.CaseDesc: On May 1, 1990, Claude L'Heureux was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Claude had worked in bars in The Village district of Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2019033665.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1988, the remains of a male were found in a field on the side of road 132 in Tracy, Québec. A camp was found near the remains.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2014004857.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1992, David Neufeld, Peter Bentzen and Kenneth Vaughan were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The three men had been associating with each other as “runners” in order to smuggle cigarettes into Canada from the United States by means of a boat. David’s vehicle and boat trailer were located at Ashbridges Bay, Toronto. The aging boat that was borrowed from a friend has never been recovered and the three men have not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020114.CaseDesc: Sebastien Metivier went missing in Montreal on November 1, 1984. The young boy was in front of the Tres-Saint-Nom-de-Jesus church on the east side of the city. He was heading to an arts and crafts course.

Pants: Blue, Patch on the right knee

Case reference: 2006007299.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1985, Byron Simmons and Julie Ann Schneider were observed fishing from a boat in Lake Huron. They were near the Nuclear Power Generation Station, near Inverhuron, Ontario, in the outflow from the nuclear plant. The couple failed to return to their cottage and are presumed drowned.  Their boat was recovered the following spring washed up on shore to the north, near Oliphant, Ontario.

Hair: Grey, White, Other, Short, Afro style

Case reference: 2006003699.CaseDesc: On July 26, 2002, a male, believed to be between the ages of 30 to 40 years old, was found in the Don River, north of the Queen Street East Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 217 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been dead for a few days.

Teeth: Full gold crown lower right first molar, a dental implant replacing upper right central incisor, multiple amalgam restorations.
Shirt: Red, T-shirt with indistinguishable white lettering

Case reference: 2014002578.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1979, Martin Corbet was seen for the last time as he went hunting in the woods.

Hat: Wool, Yellow, Toque; Yellow, Black, Orange

Case reference: 2014004979.CaseDesc: On July 23, 2007, Gad Krespine, a resident of Montreal, was last seen at approximately 10:30 am at 1755 Lierre Street in Laval, Quebec.

Case reference: 2015069712.CaseDesc: On November 15, 2015, at approximately 1:00 p.m., Blake McCool was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018063443.CaseDesc: On July 2, 2003, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Sergio Rodriguez was seen for the last time by his wife in Toronto, Ontario. When Sergio’s wife had returned home from work, he and all of his belongings were gone.

Case reference: 2015020929.CaseDesc: On April 27, 2015, Andrzej Popek was last seen at the Crawford Lake Conservation Area in Milton, Ontario.  Andrzej's abandoned vehicle was located the following day in the Conservation's parking lot.

Case reference: 2014002435.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1978, Mary Click was seen for the last time as she left her home in Madison, Wisconsin. Mary had crossed the American and Canadian border at Pigeon River and intending to hitch hike to Banff, Alberta. Some of her personal belongings were discovered in Thunder Bay, Ontario on July 1, 1978 and Raith, Ontario on August 1, 1978.

Boots: Brown, HIKING, Possibly wearing hiking boots

Case reference: 2014005512.CaseDesc: On October 4, 2010, Ivana Ferus was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario, to catch a flight destined for the Czech Republic. Ivana’s apartment keys were subsequently found in a recycling bin.

Case reference: 2014004817.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2006, Timothy Lang departed his residence in Chilliwack, British Columbia in his vehicle, a grey Chevrolet Metro. Timothy left behind all his personal belongings, wallet, and passport. On September 11, 2006, his vehicle was located in the parking lot of the Othello Tunnels in the Coquihalla Canyon Provincial Park, located in Hope, British Columbia.
